body: And then I go on until I am beneath an archway,The high whites spread over the buried earth.Where lamps are lit: these, too,Bronze the sky, with noLate February, and the air's so balmygrow hot in the parking lot, though they'reAnd all at once it is the meadow I walked in at ten,In Florida, it's strawberry seasonEvent, the end of the painted road ends upHoarfrost is in his bones and on his head,Wheel tracks entrench themselves in snow, yet paintedUnreadable from behindthey are well downThe earth beneath his feet, in its dark cape,Standing in the way of the truth. A whiteDown the long course of the gray slush of thingsI. Further Exploration of SpitsbergenTo a higher level of appearance.They tear apart the mist, it is as though,Seen. What you know is only manifest
